{{DISPLAYTITLE:Randy Peters ''Minecraft'' advertisements}}
The '''Randy Peters Minecraft advertisements''' are a series of humorous sketch videos, made to promote various miscellaneous ''Minecraft'' collaborations. They were created as a joint venture between [[Mojang Studios]], Swim Club<ref>{{Citation|url=https://swim.club/Minecraft-Randy-Peters|title=MINECRAFT â€“ Randy Peters|website=swim.club|archive=1}}</ref>, and Kurppa Hosk Communications.{{TOC limit|3}}

== Videos ==
[[File:Lose the Spoon.mp4|thumb|The Go-Gurt commercial.]]

=== LOSE THE SPOON ===
{{Main|Go-Gurt}}
==== Summary ====
A parody of infomercials, the video begins with black and white footage of [[Cool Cat]] typing on a keyboard, asking if the viewer "still eats your ''yogurt'' like this?" before showing a bowl of yogurt being spilled over the keys. A studio audience announces that it is time to "lose the spoon," as they cheer and one person fist pumps, seguing into the introduction of [[Randy Peters]]. "The Most Enthusiastic Guy We Could Find," Randy walks on stage by jumping and cheering as opposed to walking, and excitedly unveils ''Minecraft'' collaborating with the company ''Sodiaal''.

Announcing that {{Wikipedia|Go-Gurt|Go-Gurt}} "makes spoons a thing of the past," Randy begins to list various benefits of switching to the practice and credits [[Mojang Studios]] and the Go-Gurt brand for the collaboration. Taking a sip of a Go-Gurt himself, specifically the vanilla [[Nether Quartz|quartz]] variety, the [[Editor (character)|editor]] clarifies that there is no literal quartz in the product. Randy then approaches Cool Cat, who is eating yogurt on a skateboard, who he and the audience encourage to lose the spoon as well. In an instant, the spoon is replaced with a Go-Gurt, and the yogurt vanishing without explanation. Randy says that Cool Cat is now "ready to shred that gnar" while the editor clarifies that the character is portrayed by a stunt double and to not imitate their behavior. 

Announcing that the Go-Gurt is now available in stores, Randy once again encourages the viewer to "lose the spoon" and "find your favorite, now!" As the audience cheers, Randy says he will be promoting [[The Crafter's Kitchen: An Official Minecraft Cookbook|The Crafter's Kitchen]] "up next." He never does, as the video ends.

=== CANT.STOP.BRUSHING ===
{{Main|Colgate}}
==== Summary ====
A black and white child screams, as narration of Randy Peters asks if parents are having difficulty getting their kids to brush their teeth. Randy proceeds to elaborate, asking if they are hurling insults and/or slang at their parents, promoting the ''Minecraft'' toothbrush as a solution to this problem. Now credited as "being paid to say things," Randy rushes onto the stage, and promises great news, in the form of the toothbrush. Amazing the audience, Randy boasts that it "turns bedtime, into funtime!"

Explaining it as "science," Randy makes up a fantastical nonscientific method for powering the toothbrush, which the editor has to specify is hyperbolic. To back up these proven to be false claims, Randy brings over a caller, Mary McCorstin, and promptly shuts down her concerns that "the brushing never stops." Randy claims everyone is going wild over the toothbrush venture, and promises "more," referring to a vibration function and several bullet points. Urging the viewer to "not miss the boat on this one," as they are reportedly in very high demand, Randy suggests buying the product being promoted. While the audience cheers, the disclaimer editor gives their personal opinion on the claims made in the video, before explaining a long and complex story involving their mother.

As the editor elaborates on the story, blaming a character named Derrick, an awkward silence fills the room as the audience seemingly doesn't expect the video to continue as it does. The video then abruptly ends as many people stare confused and make forced smiles.

=== CROCHET ALL DAY ===
[[File:Crochet All Day.mp4|thumb|The ''The Woobles'' commercial.]]{{Main|The Woobles}}

==== Summary ====
Unlike the others, this video opens in media res, on an informal interview with a biker named Wayne Wheeler. He is in the process of crying, having apparently told a somber story to Randy Peters before an ad break. Wishing to cheer him up, Randy unveils the ''Minecraft Woobles'' collaboration, revealing himself to be a "doctor of yarn." Cool Cat arrives, removing a basket of fruit with the crochet kits, receiving an ovation from the audience. Explaining what ''the Woobles'' is, Randy assures the viewer that anyone can make one.

To Wayne's delight, he is not only getting one set of ''Minecraft'' ''Woobles'', but every set released up to that point. The audience cheers again, as Randy proceeds to reveal that he had placed ''Woobles'' kits underneath their seats. Declaring that "we all become Wooblers today!," the audience begins to come at odds over the gift. Randy instigates the conflict by jumping onto his seat and chanting "CROCHET ALL DAY" as Wayne joins him, before people begin chanting as well and several start to fight. The editor chimes in to stress this is not a real fight.

[[File:Pez the Mic.mp4|thumb|The ''PEZ'' dispenser commercial.]]

=== PEZ THE MIC ===
{{Main|PEZ}}

==== Summary ====
The video opens in media res, with Randy explaining that "the fork goes in the right hand," and promising to explain where the knife goes after a sponsor break, sponsored by ''{{Wikipedia|PEZ}}''. As the audience cheers, the scene transitions to Cool Cat using a turntable, as Randy Peters begins a rap number and an audience member stares on baffled. The song is about the ''Minecraft'' collaboration with ''PEZ'', introducing each individual ''PEZ'' dispenser. He begins with [[Steve]], then [[Alex]], a [[creeper]], and a "friendly face," a [[pig]]. As Cool Cat begins a solo, the editor writes a lengthy citation emphasizing that eating ''PEZ'' does not enhance the consumer's ability to rap and does another monologue about his father, a fantasy novel he was developing, and Derrick.

As the editor rambles, Randy and an audience member do extensive dance choreography together, culminating in several filters. Once the rambling concludes, Randy begins to list off "PEZ-ential info," and then tells the viewer to get them "at home, online, or at the mall!" A final bit of information is given: an exclusive [[enderman]] ''PEZ'' dispenser is in a gift box.

== Trivia ==
* The [[Creeper Head|creeper head]] that Cool Cat wears is a popular piece of existing merchandise, beginning production very early into the franchise history.
** Their appearance also resembles various skins from various texture packs, such as [[Skin Pack 4|Creeper Suit]] and [[1st Birthday Skin Pack|Steve Creeper Boxhead]].
*The series was created in part due to a large budget being allocated for a promotion of Go-Gurt, as well as "targeting the household buying power (millennials/gen X) and their fond memories of terrible '00s infomercials".<ref>{{Citation|url=https://www.linkedin.com/posts/chad-oetken_lifeswork-losethespoon-activity-7173511459296014336-yRMQ|title=Chad, we've got budget for a Go-Gurt ad. Any ideas?|author=Chad Oetken|website=LinkedIn|date=March 13, 2024|archive=1}}</ref>
*The scene in ''CROCHET ALL DAY'' where Randy gives everyone in attendance ''the Woobles'' is a reference to the September 13th, 2004 episode of ''The Oprah Winfrey Show'', where everyone in attendance was given a car.<ref>{{YouTube link|pviYWzu0dzk|Oprah you get a car|Blake Uhlenbrock|December 4, 2017}}</ref><ref>{{YouTube link|8CAscBCdaQg|Oprah's Ultimate Car Giveaway {{!}} Oprah's Life Class {{!}} Oprah Winfrey Network|OWN|October 15, 2011}}</ref>
*The first two episodes were created to be a duology, with the remaining videos being made in response to their popularity.<ref>{{Citation|url=https://www.linkedin.com/feed/update/urn:li:activity:7191507014525575169/|title=ðŸ†€: Is it possible to make a post about Go-Gurt and a Toothbrush go viral in 2024?<br><br>ðŸ…°: Yes. It certainly is.|author=Chad Oetken|website=LinkedIn|date=May 1, 2024|archive=1}}</ref>
